review: best app for science and mathematics study free of coast with ads free platform and also no need to sign in just install and start studying also includes hundreds of languages and many other subjects with 6500 free video lectures
Great app. However, the browser version is more robust. I use the mobile app as a supplement to the browser one.

I downloaded this to brush up on my math but it's impossible with the way they teach it. They make it so much more difficult than it needs to be. Instead of carrying numbers they have you do multiplication, division, grouping etc. It's just nonsense, I'm using the methods I learned and getting the answers before they do all of these extra unnecessary steps. Find another app if you can.

It's my honest review after listening to the Limits and Continuity chapter of Class11 (Telangana Syllabus). It's Superb App and excellent explanation of basic concepts. Hats off to you guys for explaining in simple ways. And I appreciate Khan Academy for providing the concepts for free.
I dont know it is just my phone, but in the box grids 120, theres no numbers shown in the grids making it hard to know the missing number

the app is full of lessons in different fields , even life lessons like hiw to apply for colleges and hows the experience etc. this app helped me learn different fields of math, how to use them, and tought me things missing from the national curriculum

Khan I love ya to death man but you gotta put a restart button on each test. I know you want me to persevere when I get something wrong and all but I'm just 100% not gonna do that. I'm 25 man, I get it. The fact of the matter remains though that I'm not gonna accept a sub-par score and I'm not gonna redo the entire test after the fact purely for aesthetics so your move to try and promote perseverance is doing nothing but wasting my time since I'm not gonna capitulate regardless of any reason.

This app is great for anyone wanting to learn any topic, even those that are not necessarily academic. But I have a lot of issues with it; it's slow. Articles, exercises, and videos sometimes take way too long to load. There's even one exercise that I haven't finished because it won't load and all I see is a white screen. Also, some videos will all of a sudden lower their screen and sound quality. And it's not just for one video in a single unit.
simply amazing for learning and it is free totally. This has cut cost of buying books for tutoring my 6 years old son

What is wrong with this app?? Now I'm just trying to see parent dashboard so I can give my son assignments & apparently I "don't have permission to view the content"??? What?? Please fix, this is very frustrating. Such a confusing app & its slowing my son's progress.

this is very good not just because it free but also because how Khan academy organize of matter per order, and I really like Khan Academy for the video learning..
Khan academy is great, the lessons are amazing and coverage is good but it has a problem of constantly lagging, even in a brand new phone and great internet. otherwise I have no complaints.

I downloaded this app just so I can review the website. The website is awful because they don't write the questions and solutions in a way that autistic people can also understand. We use it at my college for math classes and every khan academy assignment just leaves me crying, frustrated, and feeling stupid because they can't be bothered to write the questions for everyone to understand. I can't imagine the app is any better.

hi , I am momina . In my opinion this is the best app for study, specially for maths.from this app I got A+ in maths (o levels). thankyou for your support

Khan Academy is a great resource for free education with well-organized content and easy-to-understand videos. The adaptive learning system is helpful, but there's room for improvement. More advanced topics and personalized learning paths would enhance the experience. Interactive exercises and stronger community features could also boost engagement. The mobile app could be optimized further. Regular content updates are needed, especially in fast-changing fields. Despite these areas, Khan Academy

My experience was bad üòî....as I founded many questions wrong in the quiz and there's only one chance to answer a question in quiz which makes my child very disappointed and now she have made her maths bad....not recommended app from me...the teachers in videos have no excitement towards teacher....can be better...

I'm going to give three stars fr two reasons, one there isn't an option for question grammar, or wording. stole my daughter's information and got her Gmail password and logged us out of her Gmail terrible app

I remove one star due to the company's marketing towards donations. Khan Academy website is amazing for how available it is to students despite their background. While the company has large profits from donors, their ad makes it look like they're struggling to make ends meet. I would like to make small occasional donations of the amount I decide, but they put either 12$ per month minimum or 55$ once, which is just greed. Some courses need updating too, yet they don't bother with user feedback.

it's not so bad I just wish it was more clear and engaging it's boring no fun in learning but. still overall not an bad app

the content is amazing, but the app itself feels like it was just thrown together. it‚Äôs clunky to navigate, half the time it feels like you‚Äôre just using a stripped down version of the website, the layout looks outdated. it doesn‚Äôt feel like a proper mobile app at all, just something they slapped on the store.

Absolutely no ads, no premium plans, a simple interface and free educational lessons!! I've been using it almost my entire summer break, and it's a great way to learn something new or re-do past school lessons that I missed out on or want to revise. I can't wait to complete even more lessons in this app. Finally, the teachers there explain things throughoutly. Absolutely no complains. Only that it fails to load at start-up sometimes, however, that could be a server's issue.

The app quite literally wouldn't get downloaded (I downloaded other apps to see if the problem is specific with this app, and it was) I sent a report for google now, but I hope that whatever issue gets resolved Edit: The app finally downloaded. very nice app. doesn't has any ads and free. the only problem I face is that I don't get the right course. there are many little courses that I find on time. I hope this issue would be solved.
getting better but signup problem.its is made based on all well scopic extra topics as well as course lessons

what drives me crazy is the app not allowing restart of a test. believe me if I want to restart it "keep going" is not going to make me finish it it will just waste my time with skip yes I want to skip until I'm finally allowed to restart.
it keeps on signing out and won't sign in whatsoever. the loading screen either takes so long or actually never loads in. And sometimes, after doing an activity, it still says that I haven't done it.
Khan Academy is good and all, but it seems to work just as well on Google. I don't recommend having to get the app as it is very unnecessary.

the website is much better, I've been using khan on the web for probably over 7 years now and now that I've downloaded the app I've got to say, the app is pretty disappointing. you have to tap (very aggressively) your answer at least 2 or 3 times before it actually enters in, and for multiple choice you have to tap at least 2 of the choices before it will give you the submit button. kind of really frustrating. there also doesn't seem to be the same amount of courses as there are on the web.
It gets the job done, no more, no less. There are also some bugs here and there but they're not much of an inconvenience.
the app is full of courses, and I love it. My only issue is on tests it lags sometimes, and I accidentally click check on the next question before putting in an answer.

It is slow to open and always requires data to open even though the offline downloads are there for a reason. The app also doesn't let me click on the progress report option and many more. Great teaching though but it needs an upgrade
this app is great if you want to learn mostly everything from math to AI to science. The only problem is that there are too few questions, but I might be incorrect.

awesome. I can track my progress with the skill points system. The lessons are well detailed too. I stopped trusting in Khan academy when I had done one of their intro coding lessons and the instructions said to make food on a plate. I made a carrot and some cauliflower. Then proceeded to get a low score because they said my broccoli needed to be green. Can't trust a school that doesn't know that cauliflower exists.

An insane experience for free. I wanted to go back to school but I knew I'd be placed in lower level math, adding years to any degree program. Khan academy is giving me tons of confidence with a very clear path forward to learning much of the math I forgot from school. An excellent tool for learning.
